title.narrative: 1. ACCELERATING EDUCATIONAL DEMAND AND COMMUNITY OWNERSHIP / Communication for Development (C4D)

description.narrative: By 2022, communities have a greater demand for inclusive, equitable, quality pre-primary, primary, post-primary and informal education, especially for children living with disabilities, girls and out-of-school children, and in particular in the Sahel and East regions including in emergency situations., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Equitable Access To Quality Education. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, communities have a greater demand for inclusive, equitable, quality pre-primary, primary, post-primary and informal education, especially for children living with disabilities, girls and out-of-school children, and in particular in the Sahel and East regions including in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, communities have a greater demand for inclusive, equitable, quality pre-primary, primary, post-primary and informaleducation, especially for children living with disabilities, girls and out-of-school children, and in particular in the Sahel andEast regions including in emergency situations.

description.narrative: UNICEF has supported C4D activities to increase demand for education, with a focus on girls and specific;groups such as children living with disabilities and internally displaced children.;Five integrated communication plans were implemented in the East, Sahel, Boucle du Mouhoun, North and North Center.;1,420;community relays were established;for a cumulative 3,570 community relays functioningin 2021. 2,800,000;people including 933,000;women;were reached with messages highlighting the importance of education in emergency contexts, which has contributed to;enroll and maintain 185,627;children, including 91,208 girls in school both in humanitarian and development context | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/01/2022
